comments.body: I donâ€™t know the expiry but probably worth checking to see how soon we have to figure out how to handle this.

My ~understanding~ current guess is that the signature has been made with this key and includes a timestamp, so in a way it will never expire: artifacts signed with this key will always need to be verified with this key, regardless of the expiration status of the key. What would trigger a failure is if the signature timestamp is past the key expiration time.

So my current expectation is that when the key expires, we just add a second one, and then we check all artifacts using a keyring that contains both keys.
Right, I was more thinking of new artifacts that need a new key rather than this key becoming invalid for old artifacts.
Do you foresee any issue with just adding a second `gpg --import` at that point?
Sounds sensible, my gpg foo is very weak. I was mostly just seeing a hardcoded key and wondered what would happen once it expires.

Ah, well, you'll be seeing two hardcoded keys. ğŸ¤·

I mean, obviously at some point this could get out of hands if we produce many keys, but hopefully each one lasts for a few years.
